author: rmannibucau
msg: TOMEE-439 ClassListInfo store in a linkedhashset (because we can't impl comparable)

author: ilgrosso
msg: [SYNCOPE-124][SYNCOPE-202] Fixed concurrency issues with Quartz at JobInstanceLoader level + set transaction isolation level to READ-COMMITTED at Spring DataSource level + re-verified integration tests with all supported DBMS

author: stsp
msg: For mixed-revision moves, set the moved-here wc.db column only on children
with the same op-depth as the op-root. This makes mixed-revision moves appear
as a move of the directory at the op-root's revision, plus copies of nodes
at other revisions into the moved directory.
For example, this sequence, starting at a single-rev WC at r2 ...
... now results in the following table (op-depth zero omitted).
Whereas, before this change, the last row would read:
(db_op_copy): Replace boolean is_move parameter with move_op_depth parameter.
Set moved-here only on op-roots of moves and moved-along children at the
same op-depth. Keep moved-here set on children which have been moved into
a subtree which is itself being moved.
(op_copy_baton): Add dst_op_root_relpath for use by op_copy_txn.
(op_copy_txn): Determine the move op-root's op-depth and make this
move_op_depth parameter. Set moved-here only on moved-along children
op-roots of moves and moved-along children at the same op-depth.
Keep moved-here set on children which have been moved into only if the
copied directory is at the same op-depth as its parent.
(mixed_rev_move): Don't expect moved-here on nodes which weren't moved
along with the parent at the same revision.

author: brett
msg: [CONTINUUM-2686] list of previously prepared releases should not depend on build agent state
[CONTINUUM-2687] preparing subsequent releases appends timestamp to ID, but never lists them for performing
Improve handling of previously prepared releases, allowing multiple versions to be listed in the prepare releases dialog if prepared sequentially.
